content: Reminder: Substantive changes are expected to be committed by end-of-day Thursday. Any substantive commits after 12 midnight Eastern time require prior approval by Grahame. Non-substantive changes can continue to be made through Nov. 11.
Thank you Lloyd -- When is the IG freeze deadline?

All deadlines are listed here: http://wiki.hl7.org/index.php?title=FHIR_Ballot_Prep
For IGs, final content deadline is Nov. 18th and final freeze is Dec. 2
we have passed the final deadline for substantive freeze to R4. Any further substantive changes must be cleared with me now
Note that non-Coverage financial resources have disposition to make substantive changes until EOD Nov. 5 (based on discussions with FMG on Thursday at the WGM)
did I agree to that? why?
I'll do a dry run of the code gen again for the .net client

Yes, you agreed to that because no IGs were dependent on the FM stuff other than coverage and because Paul's travel plans made it very hard for him to meet the deadline. And the 6 days before the final freeze date still provided time to do any inter-version changes necessary.
It just means I do a whole lot of stuff twice. And once again, FM is specially allowed to be different and not conform
I marked GF#16681 as applied but discovered today that it was not applied. It subst change to DiagnosticReport and is a May ballot comment. Can it wait until R5 ? :-(
I'll have to look and see what svn 14569 actually included
What was not applied? DiagnosticReport.codedDiagnosis was changed to DiagnosticReport.conclusionCode, as described. That's what I see in the current build.
Yes sorry its there-- my mistake ....never mind :-)

Rob and I are of different opinions of what is substantive. I think that any changes to the content of the resource SD is - so a change to the element definition is substantive. Rob thinks that you can update the element definitions if the updates do not substantively change the meaning of the element. Who is right here?
Rob is correct
A substantive change is one that has a reasonable probability of changing code.
So tweaks to definitions that are unlikely to change code are not substantive
Slightly off topic, but does GitHub need a kick? My pull request has been sitting for over an hour. Or, am I in a holding pattern while other commits are processed?
Not appropriate for the Announce stream. Raise it on the committer's base stream and call Josh's attention
do another PR to kick start it
Has all the FM substative and others completed as I'm considering doing another update of the dotnet r4 client
yes all done
